definition: to stop/to halt/halt!/to hold resolutely (of a view, an aspiration etc)
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: But the plans of the Lord stand firm forever, the purposes of his heart through all generations.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华的寿算永远立定，他心中的思念万代常存。

sentences.english: The counsel of the LORD standeth for ever, the thoughts of his heart to all generations.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华的筹算永远立定，他心中的思念万代常存。

sentences.english: And he did evil, because he prepared not his heart to seek the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 罗波安行恶，因他不立定心意寻求耶和华。

sentences.english: Their "standing in the spirit of Mexico" was the main thrust of future generations widely famous.
sentences.chinese: 其“墨海中立定精神”的主旨被后人广为传颂。

sentences.english: The Lord tears down the proud man's house but he keeps the widow's boundaries intact.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华必拆毁骄傲人的家，却要立定寡妇的地界。

sentences.english: As a matter of fact, a successful person is capable of setting goals and paving the way against all odds.
sentences.chinese: 就事论事，成功者懂得立定目标，又能排除万难铺路。

sentences.english: After the completion of the turn, the horse is brought back to the track in a forward sideward manner before the second halt.
sentences.chinese: 在完成回旋之后，将马往侧前方带回到蹄迹线才立定。

sentences.english: Many are the plans in a man's heart, but it is the Lord 's purpose that prevails.
sentences.chinese: 人心多有计谋，惟有耶和华的筹算，才能立定。

sentences.english: The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our God shall stand for ever.
sentences.chinese: 草必枯干，花必凋残，唯有我们神的话，必永远立定。

sentences.english: And he did evil, for he did not set his heart to seek the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 罗波安行恶，因他不立定心意寻求耶和华。

sentences.english: The Lord's purpose is eternal, the designs of his heart go on through all the generations of man.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华的寿算永远立定，他心中的思念万代常存。

sentences.english: Persist in whatever you do and do not change your aspirations at will.
sentences.chinese: 做事要有恒心，所立定的志向不要随意更改。

sentences.english: Dost thou know the order of heaven, and canst thou set down the reason thereof on the earth?
sentences.chinese: 你岂知道天体的定律，立定天律以管治大地？

sentences.english: Concerning thy testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast founded them for ever.
sentences.chinese: 我因学你的法度，久已知道是你永远立定的。

sentences.english: But the foundation of the temple of the LORD was not yet laid.
sentences.chinese: 但耶和华殿的根基尚未立定。

sentences.english: Long ago I learned from your statutes that you established them to last forever.
sentences.chinese: 我因学你的法度，久已知道是你永远立定的。

definition: to come to a stand/to stop
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
you (used to a superior or between persons of the same generation)/below the foot
stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
